snippet: The experiment has riled many of the Indian capital’s elite even as its ability to reduce pollution remains unclear, with air quality still at “hazardous” levels Monday.
abstract: Regional government experiments with traffic restrictions to combat air pollution in New Delhi, India, which 2014 World Health Organization survey ranked worst of 1,600 cities; city's elite, accustomed to having drivers on standby, decry move, while others question whether measures will have significant effect.
lead_paragraph: The experiment has riled many of the Indian capital’s elite even as its ability to reduce pollution remains unclear, with air quality still at “hazardous” levels Monday.

headline.main: Streets, if Not the Air, Clear Out as Delhi Tests Car Restrictions
headline.print_headline: Streets, if Not the Air, Clear Out as Delhi Tests Car Restrictions
